div1.p: Hench encloses a manuscript with specific questions in regard to a number of paragraphs.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Luis B. Pogolotti, August 26, 1940
div1.opener:
copy to Mrs Phillips (to show Moran )
Photos 1-2-5-6- 11b -48-51-52-56-
57-58-59
August 26, 1940
Mr. Luis Pogolotti
Cuba 3
Havana, Cuba
My dear Mr. Pogolotti:
div1.p:
At last, permit me to send you my memorandum which I am
so anxious to have you go over in detail and correct in any way you see fit.
I am also sending another set of the snapshots which I sent you weeks ago, but
which must have been lost in the mail. I am sending Mr. Moran one of these mem-
oranda, and asking him to go over it with Senora Rojas, but I am most anxious to
have your own help in regard to a number of paragraphs.

Paragraph 6: Do you know whon the tent Camp Columbia was
erected, what this site was used for beforehand, and when the tent camp was replaced
by the wooden barracks of Columbia Barracks. When was the latter torn down and the
present Military City erected?

Par. 7: What is the relationship between Quemados and Marianao?
Is this one town or two? Is there one mayor or two? Is there a public library in
Quemados or Marianao, where I might find an old map of Marianao as of 1900? Would the
mayor or one of the officials know of some historian of the town?

Par. 32: Please correct me carefully as to my directions as
to how to get to the false site of Camp Lazear, How large is the present Military
City? (in square miles or acres). Am I right about Calzata los Quemados. How many
units are there to the present Hospital Militar de Columbia, that is, how many
buildings? When was the Fourth of September Clinic erected? On one of my hastily
sketched maps, drawn in pencil when we were visiting the false camp site, I marked
that we went down a “Boquetta Road”. This is unmarked on the map. My recollection
is that we asked the name of the road we were on, and a passerby gave us that name.
But the maps indicate that one goes directly down Santa Rosa Street to meet the
railroad track, where the little Carnino station now is. What is the relationship
between Boquetta Road and Santa Rosa Street, and where should Boquetta Road be on the
map? When did you erect the Carnino Station? What does Lidia Paradero mean?

I have asked Madame Rojas the name of some tree expert who could
estimate the age of the framboyant tree at the false site, and also that near the
shacks near the quarry on the San Jose farm.

Par. 35: Please check this paragraph carefully, particulaly
regarding the new and old names of the streets. Are the houses I mentioned made of
cement?

Pars. 38, 39: Please amplify this as much as possible. What was
your brother's name, what connection did he have with the U.S. Army or with Camp
Columbia? How did he come to buy the property around Camp Columbia? Please verify
the dates mentioned in this paragraph. I am most anxious to get accurately the real
estate pedigree of this false camp site, that is, when did your brother buy it, when
did the various previous owners buy it, and is there some official number and date
- 2 -
or designation of these deeds as reporded in the offices of the recorder of deeds,
so that if you gave me a deed number, anybody could verify our statements? I would
not think to ask you for this information except that you said you had been all over
this many times.

Par. 53: Especially please check this paragraph carefully.
Amplify as much as possible. When did you or your brother buy this from the Rojas
family? What is the date and legal identification marks or number of the deed. When
did you sell that part later used as a quarry, and to whom? When was the quarry begun
and who was the owner of the quarry company? Might he have some old photographs of the
land from time to time. What is the exact meaning of the word “tojar”?
Par. 54: Are my directions to reach the San Jose farm correct?

Par. 58: Please check this paragraph, also the last line in
Par. 59.

Will you identify the building in Photograph Number
Is it one of the units of the Military Hospital? I think it is. Is it the Fourth
of September Clinic? Kissinger gave me a photograph of Columbia Barracks and told me
that a photographer from Quemados took the photograph. Is there some old photographic
company or photographer in Marianao or Quemados who might have been there forty years
ago, or some more recent company which might have taken over the films of an older
photographer.

I cannot tell you how sincerely I have appreciated all of your
wonderful help. Without it, I could have learned very little of what I have learned,
and I earnestly request your continued help. In order to save you labor, and
in order to get from you as much detail as possible, permit me to ask you when you
prepare to answer those questions, to make an appointment with Mrs. R. Hart Phillips,
Manzana do Gomes, 553, Habana. She does stenographic work, helped me while I was in
Havana, and knows what we are trying to do. I am sure she will either meet you at
your office, or perhaps it will be easier for you to meet her at hers. She will sub-
mit your answers to you for your final correction and then send them to me, and I am
only too glad to pay the expense.
div1.closer: Very sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
